newsitem.title: FRANCE: French billboard ad investment share seen stable.
newsitem.headline: French billboard ad investment share seen stable.

text.p: Billboard advertising accounts for roughly 10 percent of the amount spent in France on advertising and that proportion should hold steady to the year 2000, Rene Saal, managing director of advertising firm Carat Expert, said on Thursday.
"The share of these investments are stable, hovering around 10 percent over the past 10 years, and should remain there to the year 2000," Saal told a news conference.
France's IREP institute said billboard advertising outlays in France totalled 5.87 billion francs in 1995, representing around 12 percent of the total.
Press advertising took the lion's share of 47 percent, compared with 33 percent for television advertising, seven percent for radio and one percent for cinemas.
